subject: Travel
title: Bessie Coleman: First Black Aviator
description: A 60-second lesson on Bessie Coleman: First Black Aviator.

hook.text: Every flight school in America rejected Bessie Coleman because of her race and gender.

buildup.text: She learned French, moved to Paris, and earned her pilot's license there in 1921.

discovery.text: She became the first Black woman and first Native American woman to hold a pilot's license.

twist.text: She refused to perform at any venue that segregated its audience. She used fame to fight racism.

climax.text: She died in a plane crash at age 34 while preparing for an air show in Jacksonville.

punchline.text: America said no, so she went to France and made history.

quiz.question: Why did Bessie Coleman go to France?
